A.title: Multiple Choice Questions
A.instructions:
i) This section consists of 16 part questions and all are to be answered. Each part question carries ½ mark.
ii) Do not copy the part questions in your answer book. Write only the answer in full against the proper number of the question and its part.

questions.question: The simplest amino acid is:
This organelle of cell contains information of protein synthesis:
Chondrichthyes (cartilaginous fish) are characterized by:
In ECG the T-waves represent:
This molecule binds to the active site of an enzyme:
This organ functions as an air conditioner:
The human enzymes are highly active at this temperature:
Lungs volume is measured by this special device:
All these animals belong to Phylum Cnidaria except:
Pulmonary veins supply blood to the:
It is not involved in antigen presentation:
Deoxygenated blood to carried to the lungs by:
The study of functioning and disorders of immune system is termed as:
Number of milk teeth in human is:
Partial negative charge and partial positive charge of water molecules attract to each other due to:
Animals with dry scaly skin, egg with amniotic coat and three chambered heart are found in this class:

B.title: Short Answer Questions
B.instructions: Attempt any EIGHT part questions in all. Select FOUR Reasoning Questions and FOUR Non-Reasoning Questions. All part questions carry equal marks.

questions.question: How does Bile help in digestion of fats?
Why are water molecules called amphoteric in nature?
Why are enzymes temperature sensitive?
Artificial sweetener is not harmful to diabetic patient. Why?
Why in Antipyretic therapy used?
Why is S.A. Node called pacemaker of the heart?
Why is haemoglobin called as respiratory pigment?
How is stomach protected from HCl?
Mention the role of arteriole in vasodilation and vasoconstriction.
List the four basic characteristics of Chordates.
Differentiate between Polyp and Medusa.
Write four characteristics of enzymes.
Define Sinuses and write their types.
Write note on Subclass Ratitae and Carinatae.
Define Diploblastic and Triploblastic animals with examples.
Differentiate between single and double circuit circulation with examples.

C.title: Detailed Answer Questions
C.instructions: Attempt any TWO question from this section. All questions carry equal marks.

options.question: Define Lipids or Carbohydrates. Write their classifications and functions with examples.
Write the general characteristics, evolutionary adaptations and economic importance of Phylum Annelida
Write the general characteristics, evolutionary adaptations and economic importance of Phylum Arthropoda
Explain first line of defense with reference of Digestive Tracts and Respiratory Tracts.
Describe Thrombus, Atherosclerosis and Angina Pectoris. Explain coronary bypass and Angioplasty.
